title: Learn Selector Layer Principles Unit | Salesforce Trailhead

questions.title: 1Which of these is not one the benefits of using a Selector layer to manage your SOQL code compared to including SOQL elsewhere?

answers.content: A You can evolve your object model more easily without large sweeps to query code.
B You can make underlying changes to common queries quickly.
C You can ensure that your queries always run in a with sharing context.
D You can expose logical data representations via Apex classes.

correctAnswer.content: C You can ensure that your queries always run in a with sharing context.

questions.title: 2Which is not one of the features of a Selector class?

answers.content: B Object-level and field-level security can be enforced on behalf of the caller optionally.
D Automatically ensures that all fields defined on the object are included in each query.

wrongAnswers.content: A Consistent population of sObject fields, regardless of which methods return query results.
C You can keep complex SOQLs contained and managed in a single place.

correctAnswer.content: D Automatically ensures that all fields defined on the object are included in each query.

questions.title: 3Which application code belongs in the Selector layer?

answers.content: A Code that performs calculations on information read from the database.
C Code that builds and executes queries and returns the resulting records to be processed by Service, Domain, Batch or UI Controller classes.
D Code that makes callouts to external endpoints.

wrongAnswers.content: B Code that validates information read from the database is correct.

correctAnswer.content: C Code that builds and executes queries and returns the resulting records to be processed by Service, Domain, Batch or UI Controller classes.
